p: Various methods were used to prepare herbal medicine used for managing diseases of the respiratory system in the study area (Table 2). The most common method was decoction (68.8%), concoction (20.8%), and chewing (4.2%) (Table 2). Other methods of preparation included cold maceration, powdering, and crushing before instillation in the nostrils which accounted for 2.1% respectively (Table 2). The main route of administration of the indigenous remedies prepared by the traditional medicine practitioners was oral (Table 2).
